newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Wharf edges up after interim earnings.
newsitem.headline: Wharf edges up after interim earnings.

text.p: Shares of Wharf (Holdings) Ltd rose from lows after it reported interim earnings growth in line with the market expectation, brokers said.
The shares rose HK$0.55 or 1.95 percent to HK$28.75 in late trade after touching an intraday low of HHK$28.30.
Volume was 1.73 million shares worth HK$49.56 million.

"The earnings growth was within expectation," said Ben Kwong, research director from Dharmala Securities. "However, an improved outlook is expected in view of some of its property projects going on sale in the near future."
Brokers said demand for blue-chips laggards aided demand.

Wharf posted net profit of HK$1.30 billion, including an exceptional gain HK$102.7 million in the six months to June 30, compared with HK$3.0 billion profit in the year earlier period which boosted by an exceptional gain of HK$1.95 billion.
Operating profit rose to HK$1.33 billion from HK$970 million. -- Hong Kong Newsroom (852) 2843 6370
